channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 2026 Super Bowl Betting Report: 'It's Still One-Way Traffic on Seattle'
item.description: Books are surprised that little action has come in on the Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX. Patrick Everson reports on that and more.

item.title: 2026 Super Bowl by College: Alabama, LSU Lead Among Patriots, Seahawks Players
item.description: Here's where players for the Patriots and Seahawks, who will face off in Super Bowl LX, played college football.

item.title: Big Bets Report: ‘Mattress Mack’ Puts $2 Million on AFC to win SBLX
item.description: High rollers have kicked off the Super Bowl betting bonanza with a few million-dollar wagers. Patrick Everson has the scoop.

item.title: 2026 World Baseball Classic Odds: USA, Japan Top Board as Favorites
item.description: The World Baseball Classic is on the horizon. Here are the latest odds for the upcoming tournament on FOX.

item.title: 2026 Super Bowl Odds: 5 Best Prop Bets for Patriots-Seahawks
item.description: Sammy P is back with his Super Bowl best bets, including a low-scoring first quarter and a long shot for MVP.

item.title: Sources: Knicks acquiring PG Alvarado from Pels
item.description: The Knicks are acquiring guard Jose Alvarado from the Pelicans in exchange for Dalen Terry, two second-round picks and cash, sources told ESPN.

item.title: Sources: Skubal wins arbitration, to make $32M
item.description: Two-time reigning AL Cy Young winner Tarik Skubal won his arbitration case over the Tigers and will make $32 million this year, sources told ESPN, giv...

item.title: Draymond remains with Warriors past deadline
item.description: Draymond Green will remain with Golden State past Thursday's trade deadline as the Warriors believe he fits well with the newly acquired Kristaps Porz...

item.title: Wetzel: Standing on the brink of anything-goes NCAA eligibility
item.description: By not controlling who is eligible, the NCAA is losing the ability to function as an organizing athletic body.

item.title: Sources: Clippers trading center Zubac to Pacers
